brief_summary.textblock:
This project examines behavioral and household characteristics associated with food
      purchasing patterns.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Household Purchasing Patterns, Eating and Recreation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Adult individual who reports making at least 75% of household food purchases

          2. Resides in City of Chicago, Illinois or surrounding suburbs

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Inability to provide informed consent in English

          2. Living in transitional housing or on a college campus

          3. Lack of a cellular or land line phone

          4. Gang presence or illegal activity in the immediate vicinity of the home, or other
             factors jeopardizing researcher safety during home visits (e.g., extreme unsanitary
             conditions)

          5. Having a household member, including the primary shopper, with a medical condition or
             food allergy that substantially influences household food choices (e.g.,
             phenylketonuria, celiac disease)

clinical_study.official_title: Delay Discounting and Household Food Choices

other_outcome.description: Absolute level and change in blood pressure between the initial assessment and a subsequent follow-up visit
Absolute level and change in body mass index between the initial assessment and a subsequent follow-up visit

primary_outcome.description: Overall diet quality and energy density (Healthy Eating Index) of household food purchases

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Diet quality, based on Healthy Eating Index applied to three 24-hour diet recalls.
Availability of obesity promoting foods in the home, assessed with 71-item score from an audit-based inventory.
Proportion of total calories from fast food, take-out/delivery, and full-service restaurants

collaborator.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
